item.description: Davinci Resolve Video Editing Audio Mixing in Davinci Resolve For best results outputting your video for YouTube don’t use the YouTube preset.
Increasing your “luck”
People with repeated success increase their chances of success by taking more shots Luck Successful People People with repeat success Increasing your visibility
The hour before work is the “Golden Hour” for productivity. Like the last hour before sunset in photography, it’s the perfect conditions to succeed References

Obsidian Keybinds Obsidian Keyboard Shortcuts These are my custom keybinds for Obsidian Open Today’s Daily Note: CMD+Shift+D Previous Day: CMD+Shift+J Next Day: CMD+Shift+K Open Weekly Note: CMD+Shift+W Previous Week: CMD+Shift+H Next Week: CMD+Shift+L Delete Note: CMD+Shift+Backspace Refactor Selection with First Line as Title: CMD+Shift+C Apply Template: CMD+T Close Panes Close Left Pane: CMD+ Close Right Pane: CMD+Shift+\

Key Reasons People Play Video Games They are a temporary escape They are social They are a challenge They demonstrate constant measurable growth References Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder

If you are struggling with Video Game Addiction, look for ways to get what you are getting out of those video games through other sources For me, it was about finding another challenge and a way to see constant measurable growth.

Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder Author: URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EHmC2D0_Hdg Key reasons people play video games They are a temporary escape They are social They are a challenge They demonstrate constant measurable growth If you are struggling with Video Game Addiction look for ways to get what you are getting out of those video games through other sources.

Audio Mixing in Davinci Resolve Davinci Resolve Audio Mixing https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H08721S3Z38&list=WL&index=27 When using background music, drop the music by 5db at 1-2khz to not conflict with the human voice range
Affirmations iOS > iOS Widgets iOS Widget for small affirmations throughout your day
Task Managers TickTick Things 3 Todoist GoodNotes Paper Todo List iOS Reminders Gmail Tasks
Kindle If you would like to read more, stop what you’re doing and go buy a Kindle. I went from not reading at all, to reading every night before bed by buying a Kindle.
If you never review what you’ve written, was there any benefit to writing it? #review

Daily Planning Daily Highlights has proven to be the most important technique for me in daily planning. I attempted having multiple daily highlights and that spiraled out of control through lack of prioritization.
Your mood is not defined by what you did, but by what you think about References Forget To-Do Lists. You Really Need a ‘Got Done’ List WIRED
Experience Designers should ensure they leave users with a sense of accomplishment References Forget To-Do Lists. You Really Need a ‘Got Done’ List WIRED
Look at the highlights of your highlights and re-write the interesting ones in your own words.
Rocket App Quick add emoji’s with slack style :word launching. It’s what I naturally try to do and how my brain thinks thanks for Slack.

When public speaking make eye contact with an individual for a complete thought. Then connect with someone else. This is like having a bunch of individual conversations which is where us Introvert’s thrive.

jQ Data / JSON This tool is a lifesaver when working with JSON and needing to parse through large amounts of it quickly

Optimizing for the Presumed Outcome Design / UX In applications in fast-paced environments, its important that we allow the user to be able to move to the next action they need to take instead of waiting for a confirmation from the server.
Figma Design UX Tips Use the simple shortcut Option + L to collapse all Layers and keep your panel looking tidy as you work through a¬†project.

The Tickler File Author: David Allen URL: https://gettingthingsdone.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/2016-Tickler-File-.pdf The Tickler File is an organizational tool which can be used to simplify the tracking of date-related items and to manage work flow.
When you find yourself procrastinating, write a crappy first draft to help get started References 12 Life Lessons From 2021 - brandonkboswell@gmail.
For tasks that you perform regularly, but infrequently, write down the key learnings so that you can avoid the same mistakes Don’t Start from Scratch References

The Dash Plus System Author: Patrick Rhone URL: https://patrickrhone.com/dashplus/ Capture Tools Analog Handwritten Daily Notes Tools for thought (Dash): Undone Action Item ‚Äî Individual items (action items and ideas) are marked with a dash preceding them.
Cooking 2022-01-13 Halved until all about the same size. Applied canola oil, salt, pepper and the paprika spice blend. 7 minutes in the air fryer and brown and beginning to soften.
Cooking 2022-01-13 Teriyaki Skirt Steak from Trader Joes. Heat the pan to high. Take the steak out of the package and get unnecessary liquid off, but didn’t not pat dry.
Leave artifacts of your past work so that you can build upon them in the future. Creative Thought
Incremental notes should be organized based on the date they were taken to capture the story of your learning and progression
If you’re going to take paper notes, you need to instill a process where you will revisit those notes and todos.
Building a foundation
When someone compliments you, resist the urge to downplay it. A smile or simple Thank you will suffice. Thank you.
Self Promotion Even though I know I should put myself out so that people can see me I still push off those tasks when they come up on my todo list.

Poka-Yoke Seth Godin Mistake proofing, or its Japanese equivalent poka-yoke (pronounced PO-ka yo-KAY), is the use of any automatic device or method that either makes it impossible for an error to occur or makes the error immediately obvious once it has occurred.

Keep a decision journal to reflect on the key decisions you made and their outcomes reflection I know of executives and investors who keep a ‚Äúdecision journal‚Äù in which they record the major decisions they make each, why they made them, and what they expect the outcome to be.

Professional Intro 2021 I studied marketing at VCU before later¬†going back to get my MBA in data analytics. I started my career in Print Design before teaching myself to code by scripting monotonous tasks in Adobe Photoshop & InDesign.

aliases: “Curse of Knowledge” Expert Blindness
Don’t Start from Scratch Starting from scratch is hard. Especially for me. The real value of PKM for me is having a foundation where I don’t have to start from scratch.

Personal Knowledge Management Tools for thought What is the end goal of having a PKM? Tool for thought? Begin writing / creating content Expand knowledge Curate Ideas Build upon existing ideas instead of purely starting back at the beginning each time

Goals Become visible in some way To make connections Open up new serendipitous opportunities Fill in latent knowledge gaps Help others by sharing Meet others who are interested in: Digital Computing Digital Productivity Making Digital tools as effective as analog tools Reducing the friction with using digital tools Reduce stress in a faster paced world Taking more control over their days Achieving their goals Creating systems for capturing ideas and acting on those ideas How to increase the speed with which you can get around on your computer.

Pitch “I spend a lot of time with my computer, but I love it. I think part of why I love it is that I’ve learned enough tricks along the way that I have for the most part gotten my computer out of the way of my thought process.
My favorite digital workflow apps I’m a digital workflow nerd. I’m constantly trying something new to improve my digital workflow.

Patient Centered Chart Data interoperability Healthkit Healthcare UX This is still tangentially related to the EHR, but I would like to see someone take steps towards a patient-centered chart that the patient owns that the EHR’s actually connect to and share data with.
Wildflower To bring enhanced at-home monitoring directly the patient. Especially those at risk for Pre-eclampsia If you’ve watched Downton Abbey.
EHR Core Values EHR The original goals behind EHRs were to make claims flow more efficiently and I would argue that in many ways they are doing that.

Challenges Designing in Healthcare Healthcare Design Optimizing for data specificity vs time spent charting Knowing where aspects of the chart need structure vs where others should be more flexible Attempting to create linearity in an inherently non-linear field Creating clean intuitive designs with a information density preferred by clinicians Data interoperability between Health System to Health System and also Patient to Health System Reforming the cost of healthcare to incentivize better outcomes.

My Design Journey I always loved computers, but I didn’t associate as a Designer until likely High School. I grew up in a very small town and we only had dial up internet, but I had an excellent communications teacher, Tracy Wainwright who taught English, Yearbook, Advanced Comm (Morning News) and Newspaper.
Phoenix Aircraft Mechanic On my way back to the Airport when leaving Phoenix I had a Lyft driver pick me up in a black Buick.
Work Life Balance Have a clear process for how you separate the end of the workday and the rest of your life Check your emails for any last urgent items.

YouTube Algorithm Relates to YouTube Optimizes for Individual Preferences There is no minimum length for monetization You have the option at pre-roll, mid-roll & post-roll ads Post-roll is disabled by default likely to increase chances of continuing to watch Your video has to be at least 8 minutes to have mid-roll ads.

Podcasting Tips for Guests from Moss Podcast H/T Moss **### Podcasting Tips for Guests Sound Record in a small, quiet room Record in the smallest and quietest room possible to reduce outside noise and echoes.

Learnings from YouTube Videos Video #1 Find some way to record audio on the screensharing computer Do a clap to help with aligning the screenshare and video Video #2 Set all computers to have Caffeine while recording

About Me Hello Everyone! I’m Brandon. I’m a Designer & Engineer deeply interested in helping people interface more easily with their computers to get things done.
Podcasting

Hiding the MacOS Dock MacOS Mac Productivity Course I have not successfully hidden the dock in my time with MacOS. I’ve attempted it no less than 3 times, and each time I feel myself missing out and wondering what is going on in the dock.

Spacemacs Modal Editing
TinkerTool Apps MacOS Productivity Great way alter your MacOS preferences without having to know all of the terminal commands. https://www.bresink.com/osx/TinkerTool.html

Polymath A polymath is a person who knows a lot about a lot of subjects. If your friend is not only a brilliant physics student but has also published a poetry collection and won prizes at political debates, you can describe her as a polymath.
Alfred Relates to: Apps A better version of Spotlight The easiest way to improve MacOS Productivity Secret Superpower is quick launching of Bookmarks completely with Keyboard Navigation

Zen10 Introduced to me by Jeff Bordogna Giving each member of your team time on a consistent basis to work on things that are not dictated by the company’s quarterly goals, but that the individual thinks will improve the company in some way.

TickTick Apps > Task Managers My preferred Task Manager as of this writing 2/7/2022 (March 2021-Present). Learned that I prefer GTD with TickTick over writing it in a notebook because I know it will get reviewed Inboxes Only Work if You Trust How They‚Äôre Drained
iOS Widgets iOS Cell Phones Your phone is the device that you interact with more than any other device. Phone widgets are interesting opportunities for interjections.
Massdrop Alt My trusty keyboard. Oddly thought I have found that I may actually type better on the Durgod Taurus despite it feeling like crap.
Karabiner Ended up binding Cap Locks + A to Ctrl + A and Cap Locks + E to Ctrl + E for Emacs shortcuts.
Hyper Keys I have attempted hyper keys on two different occasions now and have come to the same conclusion that binding to fn is easier and better and has none of the side effects.
Chrome Tips Google Chrome CMD + Opt + Down Arrow to Deselect the Browser Bar. Alternatively can do it with CMD+P and then tap Escape.
Spacehammer Focuses on Home Row Inspired by Spacemacs & Vim Uses Modal Editing Leverages Mnemonic Semantics Written in Lua A form of Keyboard Navigation Built on top of Hammerspoon https://github.
